item.title: #en @ 1477323860651429892
item.description: How can we define data domain & storage? Traditionally, an ecosystem orchestrator would centralize data within each field. More recent trends in data-asset management favor an open data-mesh architecture. Link >> https://t.co/JyMvTUHnNq @McKinsey @antgrasso via @LindaGrass0 #Data https://t.co/F23R9L74Mp

item.title: #en @ 1477323126505713674
item.description:
Here is a sample of how House members disclose their millions of dollars of stock in fossil fuel companies and defense contractors. Blurry, scanned forms, not searchable. Congress waited out the open data movement.
The status quo is fine with Speaker Pelosi, she just made clear. https://t.co/9nCUgrcewe

item.title: #en @ 1477247452801429507
item.description:
Itâ€™s easy to kinda dismiss the wealth of data available on CovidNow and GitHub, but open data and transparency were really rare across all the previous administrations.
Finally, open data boosts public trust, which is critical in a public health crisis.

item.title: #en @ 1477066300656607234
item.description:
I should add - this was a challenging year - but it has illustrated the immense power we have to hold govt to account. From open data on schools; to tracking the epidemic; to those who advocated for govt to do better, here and in media - you've all made a difference.
Thank you.

item.title: #en @ 1476504452836343811
item.description:
The pandemic should have been a greatest opportunity for Big, Open Data to date.
Unfortunately, most Governments have remained pathologically obstructive as they are only after the data that are not putting their past decisions in a bad light.
